thread.title: Hats at nine paces as racing carnival starts
thread.title_full: Hats at nine paces as racing carnival starts | afr.com

author: Sue Mitchell
title: Hats at nine paces as racing carnival starts
text:
The David Jones fashion parade at The Hub on Monday featured demure dresses from designers such as Carla Zampatti, camilla and marc, Dion Lee, Ellery and Lover and not-so-demure hats from Gregory Ladner, Max Alexander, Neill Grigg and Suzy O'Rourke. by Sue Mitchell David Jones got the jump on arch rival Myer as the Spring Racing Carnival looms, taking advantage of Melbourne Spring Fashion Week to launch its latest racewear collections.
The David Jones fashion parade at The Hub on Monday featured demure dresses from designers such as Carla Zampatti, camilla and marc, Dion Lee, Ellery and Lover and not-so-demure hats from Gregory Ladner, Max Alexander, Neill Grigg and Suzy O'Rourke.
The parade was hosted by David Jones racewear ambassador Emma Freedman and the face of the Caulfield Cup Carnival, Emma Notarfrancesco. Front-row guests included Thurley designer Helen O'Connor, Melbourne Racing Club stylist Lana Wilkinson and Nadia Bartel.
â€‹The spring racing season is big business for David Jones and Myer, helping to boost sales of dresses, suits, hats, shoes and handbags during the otherwise quiet months of September, October and November before Christmas shopping starts.
The 2014 Melbourne Cup Carnival contributed $374.2 million in "gross economic benefit" to Victoria, a report by the Victoria Racing Club showed. Racegoers bought 375,938 fashion items, including 75,000 hats and fascinators, 61,000 dresses, 59,000 pairs of shoes, 30,000 handbags, 17,000 shirts and 15,000 suits.
Myer, which has been a sponsor of the Victorian Racing Club for more than 35 years, will hold its first racing season event on September 10, hosting a spring fashion lunch at Flemington Racecourse, followed by Myer Fashions on the Field at Randwick on October 10 and the WA State Final at Ascot on October 17.
